alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 9:01AM AKST until January 20 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...VERY COLD NORTHERLY OUTFLOW WINDS WITH REDUCED VISIBILITY IN BLOWING SNOW ARE CAUSING HAZARDOUS CONDITIONS ALONG THE KLONDIKE HIGHWAY NORTH OF SKAGWAY THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR PERIODS OF FREEZING DRIZZLE AND LIGHT SNOW EXPECTED TONIGHT INTO EARLY SATURDAY FOR PRINCE OF WALES ISLAND... ..WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero near White Pass. Blowing snow with white out conditions. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...The Klondike Highway in the municipality of Skagway. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Visibilities will be reduced to one half mile or less at times in blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chill values may rise above minus 35 degrees at times during the daytime hours. Reduced visibilities in blowing snow will make vehicular travel very hazardous.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
